snippet: President François Hollande was responding to remarks by Secretary of State John Kerry, who said that any agreement reached at the climate conference was “not going to be a treaty.”
abstract: French Pres Francois Hollande stresses that agreement at upcoming Paris climate conference must be legally binding; remarks are response to Sec of Sate John Kerry's assertion agreement would not be treaty; State Dept officials confirm pursuit of binding provisions, and explain Congressional opposition requires subtle political approach.
lead_paragraph: President François Hollande was responding to remarks by Secretary of State John Kerry, who said that any agreement reached at the climate conference was “not going to be a treaty.”

headline.main: France Says Climate Talks Must Produce Binding Deal
headline.print_headline: France Says Climate Talks Must Produce Binding Deal
